statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: freeThrows
statistics.description: Free Throw makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.name: rebounds
statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.name: defensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.

statistics.name: offensiveRebounds
statistics.description: The number of times when the offense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot.

header.gameNote: 2005 2K SPORTS COACHES VS CANCER CLASSIC AT LUBBOCK TX

article.description: Kevin Fleming scored 15 points to help lead San Jose State past Portland 82-53 Friday in the consolation game of the 2K Sports College Hoops Classic.
article.headline: San Jose State 82, Portland 53
article.story: LUBBOCK, Texas (AP) -- Kevin Fleming scored 15 points to help lead San Jose State past Portland 82-53 Friday in the consolation game of the 2K Sports College Hoops Classic. Despite having eight team fouls in the first seven minutes of the second half, San Jose State (1-1) managed to build a 29-point lead after being up by 14 at halftime. Portland (0-2) shot under 40 percent from the field, although the team was 42 percent from behind the 3-point line. Menelik Barbary scored 12 points while grabbing 13 rebounds for his first double-double as a Spartan. Portland kept close in the first half but then allowed the Spartans to take a 15-point lead, thanks in part to a 18-5 run before the 3 minute mark. Pooh Jeter finished with 13 points in the effort for the Pilots along with Kevin Field, who had a double-double with 10 points and 10 rebounds. The win is San Jose State coach George Nessman's first Division I victory as a head coach.
